title: Automate AI Image Generation & Telegram Delivery with Google Drive and Sheets

readme:
This template is built for both self-hosted and cloud-based n8n instances using OpenAI, Google Sheets, Google Drive, and Telegram integrations.

* * *

## ğŸ› ï¸ Image Generator Workflow Setup Guide (n8n)

This workflow allows users to generate high-quality AI images from Telegram prompts using OpenAI's image generation API, LangChain-based prompt expansion, and logging via Google Drive and Google Sheets.

* * *

## âš™ï¸ Prerequisites

For **either self-hosted or cloud-based n8n** , you will need:

### Required Accounts & API Access:

  * âœ… **Telegram Bot Token** (from [@BotFather](https://t.me/BotFather))

  * âœ… **OpenAI API Key** (with access to `gpt-image-1`)

  * âœ… **Google Account** with:

    * Google Sheets
    * Google Drive
  * âœ… (Optional) LangChain or Google Gemini API if using prompt enhancement




* * *

## ğŸ’» Self-Hosted vs Cloud-Based Comparison

Feature | Self-Hosted n8n | n8n Cloud (official)  
---|---|---  
Hosting & Maintenance | You manage | n8n manages everything  
Webhook Accessibility | Must expose port via domain/IP | Instantly accessible via HTTPS  
Credential Security | Fully in your control | Managed by n8n Cloud  
Scaling & Performance | You control resources | Managed based on your plan  
Pricing | Hosting cost + n8n free/open | Subscription-based  
  
* * *

## âœ… Setup Steps

### Step 1: Prepare Google Drive

  1. Create a folder, e.g., **"AI Image Generation"**.
  2. Right-click â†’ Share â†’ **"Anyone with the link can view"**.
  3. Copy the folder ID from the URL:  
`https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/<FOLDER_ID>`



* * *

### Step 2: Prepare Google Sheets

  1. Create a new Sheet: **"Marketing Team Log"**.
  2. Add headers in the first row:


    
    
    Title | Type | Request | ID | Link | Post
    

  1. Share it with your Google-connected service account or n8nâ€™s OAuth-connected email.



* * *

### Step 3: Setup Telegram Bot

  1. Talk to [@BotFather](https://t.me/BotFather)
  2. Create a bot and get your token
  3. Add the bot to your Telegram group/channel (if needed)



* * *

### Step 4: Configure Credentials in n8n

In **n8n â†’ Credentials** , set up:

  * `Telegram API`: Paste your Bot Token
  * `OpenAI API`: Bearer token under "HTTP Header Auth"
  * `Google Drive`: OAuth2 credentials
  * `Google Sheets`: OAuth2 credentials



* * *

### Step 5: Configure LangChain Prompt Enhancer (Optional)

You can use either:

  * LangChain node (with Gemini or OpenAI)
  * Gemini via Google PaLM API (used in your current setup)



Set your API key and model (`gemini-2.5-pro-preview-05-06` or GPT-4).

* * *

### Step 6: Customize Image Prompt Agent

The image prompt node takes a **basic input like "a cat in space"** and expands it into a richly detailed prompt. This helps generate more artistic and realistic images.

* * *

### Step 7: Telegram Trigger Integration

  * This node listens for incoming messages from Telegram.

  * It captures:

    * `chatID`
    * `imagePrompt`
    * `imageTitle` (if you want to allow custom titles)



* * *

### Step 8: Image Generation

  * The expanded prompt is sent to OpenAIâ€™s image API.

  * The image is returned as a base64 JSON blob.

  * It's converted to binary and sent to:

    * **Telegram (as a photo)**
    * **Google Drive**
    * **Google Sheets (with image metadata)**



* * *

## ğŸ” Example Flow

  1. **User types** in Telegram:  
`Image: A cozy cabin in snowy forest`

  2. Workflow:

     * Extracts the prompt

     * Expands it using LangChain agent

     * Sends to OpenAI to generate image

     * Converts to binary and sends image:

       * back to Telegram
       * to Google Drive
       * logs metadata in Google Sheets



* * *

## ğŸ“Œ Optional Improvements

  * Add a **caption or post** generator using the Gemini node
  * Add a **cooldown check** to avoid spam from Telegram users
  * Implement an **image generation quota per user**
  * Add **approval flow** before image is stored



* * *

## ğŸŒ Deployment Tips

### For **self-hosted n8n** :

  * Use a reverse proxy (e.g., NGINX) with SSL (via Let's Encrypt)
  * Set proper environment variables for OAuth
  * Run on a VPS or cloud server (e.g., DigitalOcean, AWS)



### For **n8n Cloud** :

  * No setup needed for webhooks or SSL
  * Use OAuth2 credentials for Google integrations
  * Your Telegram webhook will work instantly
readme_html:
This template is built for both self-hosted and cloud-based n8n instances using OpenAI, Google Sheets, Google Drive, and Telegram integrations.

ğŸ› ï¸ Image Generator Workflow Setup Guide (n8n)

This workflow allows users to generate high-quality AI images from Telegram prompts using OpenAI's image generation API, LangChain-based prompt expansion, and logging via Google Drive and Google Sheets.

âš™ï¸ Prerequisites

For either self-hosted or cloud-based n8n, you will need:

Required Accounts & API Access:

  • âœ… Telegram Bot Token (from @BotFather)

  • âœ… OpenAI API Key (with access to gpt-image-1)

  • âœ… Google Account with:

    • Google Sheets
    • Google Drive

  • âœ… (Optional) LangChain or Google Gemini API if using prompt enhancement

ğŸ’» Self-Hosted vs Cloud-Based Comparison

Feature Self-Hosted n8n n8n Cloud (official)
Hosting & Maintenance You manage n8n manages everything
Webhook Accessibility Must expose port via domain/IP Instantly accessible via HTTPS
Credential Security Fully in your control Managed by n8n Cloud
Scaling & Performance You control resources Managed based on your plan
Pricing Hosting cost + n8n free/open Subscription-based

âœ… Setup Steps

Step 1: Prepare Google Drive

  1. Create a folder, e.g., "AI Image Generation".
  2. Right-click â†’ Share â†’ "Anyone with the link can view".
  3. Copy the folder ID from the URL:
    https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/<FOLDER_ID>

Step 2: Prepare Google Sheets

  1. Create a new Sheet: "Marketing Team Log".
  2. Add headers in the first row:
Title | Type | Request | ID | Link | Post
  1. Share it with your Google-connected service account or n8nâ€™s OAuth-connected email.

Step 3: Setup Telegram Bot

  1. Talk to @BotFather
  2. Create a bot and get your token
  3. Add the bot to your Telegram group/channel (if needed)

Step 4: Configure Credentials in n8n

In n8n â†’ Credentials, set up:

  • Telegram API: Paste your Bot Token
  • OpenAI API: Bearer token under "HTTP Header Auth"
  • Google Drive: OAuth2 credentials
  • Google Sheets: OAuth2 credentials

Step 5: Configure LangChain Prompt Enhancer (Optional)

You can use either:

  • LangChain node (with Gemini or OpenAI)
  • Gemini via Google PaLM API (used in your current setup)

Set your API key and model (gemini-2.5-pro-preview-05-06 or GPT-4).

Step 6: Customize Image Prompt Agent

The image prompt node takes a basic input like "a cat in space" and expands it into a richly detailed prompt. This helps generate more artistic and realistic images.

Step 7: Telegram Trigger Integration

  • This node listens for incoming messages from Telegram.

  • It captures:

    • chatID
    • imagePrompt
    • imageTitle (if you want to allow custom titles)

Step 8: Image Generation

  • The expanded prompt is sent to OpenAIâ€™s image API.

  • The image is returned as a base64 JSON blob.

  • It's converted to binary and sent to:

    • Telegram (as a photo)
    • Google Drive
    • Google Sheets (with image metadata)

ğŸ” Example Flow

  1. User types in Telegram:
    Image: A cozy cabin in snowy forest

  2. Workflow:

    • Extracts the prompt

    • Expands it using LangChain agent

    • Sends to OpenAI to generate image

    • Converts to binary and sends image:

      • back to Telegram
      • to Google Drive
      • logs metadata in Google Sheets

ğŸ“Œ Optional Improvements

  • Add a caption or post generator using the Gemini node
  • Add a cooldown check to avoid spam from Telegram users
  • Implement an image generation quota per user
  • Add approval flow before image is stored

ğŸŒ Deployment Tips

For self-hosted n8n:

  • Use a reverse proxy (e.g., NGINX) with SSL (via Let's Encrypt)
  • Set proper environment variables for OAuth
  • Run on a VPS or cloud server (e.g., DigitalOcean, AWS)

For n8n Cloud:

  • No setup needed for webhooks or SSL
  • Use OAuth2 credentials for Google integrations
  • Your Telegram webhook will work instantly
